Title: Buttermilk Biscuits
Ingredients: 2 cups self-rising flour|1/4 cup cold butter cubed|3/4 cup buttermilk|1 tablespoon sugar
Directions: Preheat oven to 450°F|Cut butter into flour until crumbly|Add buttermilk and sugar stir until just combined|Drop by spoonfuls onto baking sheet|Bake 12-15 minutes until golden
Notes: Do not overmix the dough. Serve warm with butter and jam.

Title: Chicken and Dumplings
Ingredients: 1 whole chicken cut up|8 cups water|2 cups self-rising flour|1/4 cup shortening|3/4 cup milk|Salt and pepper to taste
Directions: Boil chicken in water until tender|Remove chicken and shred|Make dumplings by cutting shortening into flour|Add milk to form soft dough|Drop dumplings into boiling broth|Simmer 15 minutes|Add chicken back and season
Notes: The dumplings will puff up as they cook. For thicker broth add 1/4 cup flour mixed with water.

Title: Cornbread Dressing
Ingredients: 6 cups crumbled cornbread|4 slices white bread torn|1 cup chopped celery|1 cup chopped onion|2 cups chicken broth|2 eggs beaten|1 teaspoon sage|Salt and pepper to taste
Directions: Combine cornbread and white bread in large bowl|Sauté celery and onion until soft|Mix all ingredients together|Pour into greased 9x13 pan|Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes until golden
Notes: Can be made a day ahead and reheated. Add more broth if mixture seems too dry.

Title: Banana Pudding
Ingredients: 1 box vanilla wafers|4-5 ripe bananas sliced|2 cups milk|1 box instant vanilla pudding|8 oz cream cheese softened|1 can sweetened condensed milk|12 oz whipped topping
Directions: Beat cream cheese until fluffy|Add condensed milk and beat well|Mix pudding with milk according to package|Fold pudding mixture into cream cheese mixture|Fold in whipped topping|Layer wafers bananas and pudding in dish|Refrigerate 2 hours
Notes: Top with extra wafers and banana slices before serving. Best if chilled overnight.

Title: Fried Okra
Ingredients: 1 pound fresh okra cut into rounds|1 cup cornmeal|1/2 cup flour|1 teaspoon salt|1/2 teaspoon black pepper|1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper|Vegetable oil for frying
Directions: Heat oil to 375°F in deep skillet|Mix cornmeal flour salt and peppers in bowl|Dredge okra in cornmeal mixture|Fry in batches until golden brown about 3-4 minutes|Drain on paper towels|Season with additional salt if desired
Notes: Don't overcrowd the pan or okra will steam instead of fry. Frozen okra can be used but should be thawed and patted dry first.
